abstract.para: This section provides a brief guide for creating custom images based on &productname;, allowing you to build a system tailored to your solution's needs. The entire process relies on the KIWI NG image builder and can be summarized into the following key stages:

topic.para: For a complete description of how KIWI GN works, refer to the KIWI documentation.

section.title: Downloading files for image customization
section.para: To get the necessary files that define the custom image, proceed as follows:

step.para: Download the content of the package SL-Micro.

section.title: Modifying image definitions files
section.para: In the SL-Micro package, there is the build definition file SL-Micro.kiwi. You can modify the file to suit your needs as described bellow:

RPM packages to install. For details, refer to the packages definition.

section.para: For a complete specification of the elements, refer to the KIWI image description.

section.title: Adding custom files
section.para: You can add your custom configuration files to the image. To do so, proceed as follows:

step.para: Navigate to the directory with the build definition file.
Create a root directory if it does not exist.
Inside root, create the directory path where you want your file to be placed.
Place your custom configuration file in that directory.

section.para: Alternatively, to generate the files during the image build process, use the config.sh scipt. For details, refer to the KIWI documentation.

section.title: Building the custom image
section.para: After you have prepared all necessary files and the directory structure, you can use kiwi-ng to build the image. To build it directly with kiwi-ng you need to have version included in &slea; 16.0 or higher. Alternatively, you can use a container.
